column4: i don't have a swap partition. i have 4 gigs of ram.  do i need a swap partition? and if I don't have one and i run out of memory, will i get a pleasant message or will ubuntu crash or something?
I run 1GB RAM and without a swap space at all,  and things run pretty well
I think I read that swap should be no bigger than 512MB RAM
i thought swap partitions should be quite big otherwise you're just going to get an extra 512mb ram. why not have 5 gigs of extra 'ram'?
